After a half season at Milan, Gonzalo Higuain is ready to start the next chapter of his career in the Premier League. The remaining details between Chelsea, Juventus and Milan for the transfer of the Argentine striker as well as Krzysztof Piatek’s move to the rossoneri have been resolved this evening. Newcastle United looking at Monaco full-back Antonio Barreca

Premier League side Newcastle United are looking at a possible deal for AS Monaco’s Italian full-back Antonio Barreca, according to Gianluca di Marzio.

The Italian reporter doesn’t offer much else in the way of information, but ASM have been seeking to rid of the former Torino player this month.

https://www.getfootballnewsfrance.com/2019/newcastle-united-looking-at-monaco-full-back-antonio-barreca/

Inter considering Man United asking price for Darmian, Leicester's Silva an option

Inter are looking to add to several areas of the squad, and have some targets in the Premier League in mind. Leicester's Adrien Silva is an option, having played two matches during the season. Gagliardini could depart, and Silva would serve as a replacement for the midfield. Matteo Darmian from Manchester United could come to reinforce Inter's defense, and the Red Devils have named their price: €6 million loan plus €6 million purchase option, with the player's full wages being taken on. The price is steep for Inter, as it was for Juventus who had also made advances for Darmian in recent days. Inter will continue to monitor the situation, as he would be considered a replacement player for the back line should Miranda depart the club.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/inter-considering-man-united-asking-price-for-darmian-leicesters-silva-an-option

Napoli, contacts made for Villarreal's Fornals: the situation

While PSG continue to press for for Allan, Napoli thinks about the midfield of their future. This is why contacts have been made with La Liga's Villarreal for Pablo Fornals, the 1996 born midfielder who likes the Neapolitan management. The player is not considered an urgent purchase by the club: it is not a transfer that needs to be completed as soon as possible. For this reason Fornals is a negotiation for the summer.

Leaving Campania - and always towards Spain - continues to be the negotiation for Rog with Sevilla. The problem is linked to the right of redemption.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/napoli-contacts-made-for-villarreals-fornals-the-situation

PSG continue to make progress in their attempts for Idrissa Gueye (Everton)

L’Équipe report this morning that Ligue 1 champions PSG are continuing to progress in their efforts to sign 29-year-old midfielder Idrissa Gueye from Everton.

The newspaper claims that Pini Zahavi, the Israeli super-agent, is responsible for the advancement of talks in recent hours. An initial bid worth €25m was knocked back by The Toffees, and EFC’s demands have not changed: somewhere between €30m and €35m.

Talks have reportedly intensified in recent hours and the clubs’ negotiating positions are no longer so far away. Gueye for his part is determined to join the capital club, with some officials at PSG even believing that a deal could official as soon as Sunday.

https://www.getfootballnewsfrance.com/2019/psg-continue-to-make-progress-in-their-attempts-for-idrissa-gueye-everton/

replies.msg:
The centre-back is in no hurry to leave, although Ajax and Netherlands team-mate Frenkie de Jong has already been tempted away to Barca in a deal worth €86m.

"Am I annoyed by the rumours? No. Bored? A little bit," De Ligt said to ESPN.

"But it doesn't matter to me if there's an article about where I should go or what I should do. It doesn't matter, at all.

"This place means a lot to me. I grew up here. I came here when I was nine years old.

"At Ajax you learn to win every game, to be at your best every game and it doesn't matter who your opponent is. It's in my blood."

The club's chief executive Edwin van der Sar himself left Ajax to forge a successful career for European giants Juventus and Manchester United.

And the former Netherlands goalkeeper accepts it is a challenge for Ajax, who are second in the Eredivisie, to hold on to star names such as De Jong and De Ligt.

"That's the big question of course, when you see the numbers," Van der Sar told ESPN.

"But we are a club that's financially very stable. We have a war chest. Our stadium is sold out every match. We have good commercial partners.

RB Leipzig offer Timo Werner new €6m per season contract

RB Leipzig have offered Timo Werner a contract extension that includes an exit clause for Barcelona, Real Madrid, Liverpool, Manchester City, Paris Saint-Germain, Juventus and Bayern Munich, according to Bild.

The contract would see the Germany international almost double his €3.1m-a-year salary to €6m while the contract includes a €70m exit clause for the aforementioned clubs.

If Werner doesn’t sign an extension – his current deal expires in 2020 – then RB Leipzig will likely sell in the summer but if he does, then this not only gives the Bundesliga club security over the transfer fee, but it would also mean Werner is likely to remain at Leipzig for another season.

Club Statement: 24/01/19

It is with a heavy heart that we report the latest development in the search for Emiliano Sala and pilot David Ibbotson.

Harbour Master Captain, David Barker, said: “Despite the best efforts of air and search assets from the Channel Islands, UK and France, which has covered an area of approximately 1,700sq. miles - with a significant amount of this searched more than once - and having examined mobile phone data and satellite imagery, we have been unable to find any trace of the aircraft, the pilot or the passenger." Full statement.

At this time of immeasurable sadness, our thoughts are with the family and friends of both men on board, the fans of both FC Nantes, Cardiff City, and their connections around the world.

Tan Sri Vincent Tan said: “Monday evening’s news shook everyone at Cardiff City FC to the core.

“We were looking forward to providing Emiliano with the next step in his life and career.

“Those who met Emiliano described a good-natured and humble young man who was eager to impress in the Premier League.

“The response from the football community has been truly touching and we place on record our sincere thanks to those who have sent messages of support.

“We also thank everyone involved with the search and rescue operation, and continue to pray for Emiliano, David Ibbotson and their families.”

LionRock Capital becomes Inter’s second-largest shareholder

LionRock Capital has agreed to buy 31.05% of shares in FC Internazionale Milano from International Sports Capital HK Limited.

Through International Sports Capital HK Limited, Erick Thohir become the majority shareholder of Inter in 2013 but has now sold all his shares of the club.

“We are very optimistic about the business development prospects of all sports-related activities and with over 110 years of history and global influence in the football area, FC Internazionale Milano has exciting future development potential,” said Daniel Kar Keung Tseung, Founder and Managing Director of LionRock Capital. “LionRock Capital will fully support Inter’s key objective to make the Club one of the world’s top football clubs both on and off the pitch.”

LionRock Capital was founded in January 2011 based in Hong Kong.

Asked if signings will become necessary if Tottenham suffer any further injuries, Pochettino said: "No, why? We have plenty of young players that can play.

"We are going to sign if we identify the player that can improve us. We are not going to sign because we have some injuries. We have enough players to cover injuries.

Serge Aurier and Lucas Moura are both actively attempting to convince Rabiot to join Spurs this winter. On the PSG side of things, they retain a very good relationship with Tottenham boss Daniel Levy, and the capital club favours a sale to Spurs this month.

Rabiot is hesitating: on the one hand he likes a lot the British capital and would be delighted to join back up with his former team-mates; on the flip side, his preferred destination in England is Liverpool, if he was to ever move to the Premier League.

Inter, from Carrasco to Perisic & De Paul: the situation

The Gunners have now set their sights on Ivan Perisic, they have offered Inter €5 million for a loan until end of the season with an option to buy set at €40 million. The nerazzurri have turned down this proposal as they are currently only interested in moving the Croatian winger on a permanent sale.

Inter meanwhile are continuing their push for Yannick Carrasco. The sides are looking to bring this complex negotiation to an end. In an effort to convince Dalian Yifang, the nerazzurri have offered Antonio Candreva as part of the deal. Candreva's agents have admitted that the player could be on the way out of Italy.

On Monday morning Inter will meet with Udinese over Rodrigo de Paul, who they are looking to bring in next summer. However, if Perisic leaves in January they could advance on him sooner. There is already competition for de Paul, with Napoli offering €30 million plus Younes to Udinese, and with Carlo Ancelotti pushing for the player.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/arsenal-submit-bid-for-inter-winger-perisic-the-situation

Gladbach forward Alassane Pléa a priority for Dalian Yifang

L’Équipe report this afternoon that French international and Gladbach forward Alassane Pléa has emerged as a transfer window priority for Chinese Super League outfit Dalian Yifang.

After attempting to sign Dimitri Payet earlier on in the window Dalian Yifang have turned their attentions to 25-year-old and they had representatives present at Gladbach vs Augsburg (2-0) yesterday to meet the German club’s board.

The Chinese club have begun the negotiations at €40m – Gladbach are aware of the potential resale value they could make out of this deal in what would be the biggest transfer in their history.

https://www.getfootballnewsfrance.com/2019/gladbach-forward-alassane-plea-a-priority-for-dalian-yifang/

Leonardo Jardim had an offer from an unnamed English club in recent days

Téléfoot report this morning that Leonardo Jardim had received an offer from an unnamed English side in recent days, but decided to return to Monaco to attempt to save the Principality club from relegation to Ligue 2.

This mysterious offer is not adjudged to have been from Leicester City, who had however placed the Portuguese technician on their shortlist to replace Claude Puel, were the Frenchman to face the sack.

Jardim will receive €4m a year net on his new 2.5 year Monaco contract, the same amount he was earning before he was sacked, on top of the €8m in severance pay that he received for being sacked in the middle of last October.

The return of Jardim also marks the renewed power of Jorge Mendes on the Principality, who is responsible for the imminently confirmed arrivals of Gelson Martins (Atletico Madrid) and Carlos Vinicius (Napoli).

Monaco continue to advance on Lille midfielder Thiago Mendes (26), with just hours remaining of this January window.

https://www.getfootballnewsfrance.com/2019/leonardo-jardim-had-an-offer-from-an-unnamed-english-club-in-recent-days/

Bayern Munich have not given up on signing Benjamin Pavard this month

German giants Bayern Munich and their Sporting Director Hasan Salihamidzic have not yet given up on signing French international defender Benjamin Pavard for this month, bring a pre-arranged summer transfer forward by 6 months.

Earlier this month, Bayern announced the €35m signing of Pavard, to go through in June, but the Bundesliga champions want to push through a deal this month and bring Pavard into the squad immediately.

As a result, France Football report that in the coming days, Bayern will submit an offer worth close to €50m to allow for Stuttgart to release the player 6 months early.

Now we wait to see if that convinces VfB…

https://www.getfootballnewsfrance.com/2019/bayern-munich-have-not-given-up-on-signing-benjamin-pavard-this-month/

Newcastle approach for Stanley N’Soki rejected by PSG

Ligue 1 leaders PSG have rejected an approach from Premier League side Newcastle United to loan left-sided defender Stanley N’Soki until the end of the season, according to RMC.

Les Parisiens want the 19-year-old to remain in their 1st team – his current deal expires in two years and he is proving difficult to convince to sign an extension. PSG will re-assess the situation in summer, as they want to avoid another Adrien Rabiot situation.

https://www.getfootballnewsfrance.com/2019/newcastle-approach-for-stanley-nsoki-rejected-by-psg/

Arsenal have made an approach for Napoli right-back Kévin Malcuit

France Football report that Arsenal have made an approach for Napoli’s French right-back Kévin Malcuit, as they seek to react to Hector Bellerin’s recent injury that will keep the Spaniard out until the end of the season.

Malcuit is Unai Emery’s priority at right-back, a player who cost €11m this summer just gone in a deal that saw the player move from Lille to Napoli.

The principal difficulty the Gunners will face is negotiating with Napoli President Aurelio De Laurentiis, who is known for being very difficult in terms of deal-making.

https://www.getfootballnewsfrance.com/2019/arsenal-have-made-an-approach-for-napoli-right-back-kevin-malcuit/

HAMMERS INTERESTED IN FLECK

West Ham are interested in signing Sheffield United midfielder John Fleck, according to Sky sources.

We understands talks have been held regarding a £4m deal.

Fleck, who was Sheffield United’s Player of the Year last season, has three-and-a-half-years left on his contract.

The 27-year-old moved to Bramall Lane on a free transfer after his Coventry City contract ran out in the summer 2016.

Inter set to trigger buy-back clause for Gravillon: the player will finish season with Pescara

Inter are set to sign French defender Andrew Gravillon back from Pescara. The Nerazzurri will in fact trigger the buy-back clause for the defender born in 1998, who will stay with Pescara on loan until the end of the season. The player's agents will meet Inter today and sign his new contract with Inter.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/inter-set-to-trigger-buy-back-clause-for-gravillon-the-player-will-finish-season-with-pescara

Napoli, Rog set to join Sevilla on loan

Croatian midfielder Marko Rog is set to leave Napoli to get some more playing time in the Spanish league at Sevilla. The two clubs have in fact reached an agreement for a six-months-loan deal, with no option to buy.

With this transfer formula, Napoli showed that they value the midfielder qualities and that they don't want to sell him outright. Rog will leave on Tuesday and finish this season with the Spanish club.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/napoli-rog-set-to-join-sevilla-on-loan

DEPAY KEEN ON MAN CITY OR CHELSEA MOVE

Memphis Depay has set his sights on a move away from Lyon in the summer, citing Man City and Chelsea as two of six clubs he would like to join.

"I want a new transfer to a top-level club this summer. Lyon is a big club but it's not one of the five best in Europe," Depay told Dutch magazine Helden.

"I want to go to a club like Real Madrid, Barcelona, Chelsea, Manchester City, Paris Saint-Germain or Bayern Munich.

"I want to go to a city that suits me and a club that suits me, to a team that really wants to play football.

"I always talk about Real Madrid, a royal club. White and gold shirts."

FC Köln apply to FIFA for the eligibility of Anthony Modeste

2. Bundesliga club FC Köln have applied to FIFA for the eligibility of Anthony Modeste, who rejoined his former side after dissolving his contract with Tianjin Quanjian.

An official club statement released on Tuesday read: “Independent of the proceedings between Anthony Modeste and his former club, Tianjin Tianhai (previously Tianjin Quanjian), 1. FC Köln have applied for the striker’s eligibility to play.

The question of the eligibility is not related to the proceedings between Anthony Modeste and his former club, of which 1. FC Köln are not part of. Neither the FIFA verdict of December 2018 nor its rationale deny that the striker has become a contract-free player by the termination of his employment relationship with Tianjin Quanjian.”

https://www.getfootballnewsgermany.com/2019/fc-koln-apply-to-fifa-for-the-eligibility-of-anthony-modeste/

Bayern Munich reach agreement to sell Sandro Wagner

Bayern Munich and Chinese Super League club Tianjin TEDA have reached an agreement over the €5 million transfer of Germany international Sandro Wagner, according to Sky Germany.

The 31-year-old will earn €15m until the end of 2020. Sky’s report suggest the deal is likely to be concluded on Wednesday, before Thursday’s deadline.

EDIT: Bild are now reporting that Wagner has signed a contract in Alicante, Spain & is expected to join the CSL club imminently.

Mesut Özil turns down PSG loan move

Arsenal & former Germany international Mesut Özil has rejected a loan move to Ligue 1 club Paris Saint-Germain, according to Süddeutsche Zeitung.

A reliable outlet, they suggest that PSG head coach is looking for attacking reinforcements following the injury to Neymar, who is expected to be out for numerous weeks.

Arsenal head coach Unai Emery has yet to get the best out of Özil, which has resulted in the 30-year-old being left out of the squad a number of times due to “tactical reasons” which has produced speculation regarding his future.

The transfer of Barcelona playmaker Denis Suarez to Arsenal could potentially see the German depart the club.

Inter Milan had also shown an interest in Özil but with his recent contract extension at the Emirates, a deal may be out of their salary range.

More follows.

https://www.getfootballnewsgermany.com/2019/mesut-ozil-turns-down-psg-loan-move/

Ivorian international and Lille superstar attacker Nicolas Pépé has turned down an approach from Chinese Super League side Dalian Yifang, who were prepared to offer €70m + €10m in bonuses to sign the player, according to France Football.

Bayern Munich working deal for unnamed French striker

RMC report that German giants Bayern Munich are working on a deal to sign a French striker for next summer who is already playing in the Bundesliga, but that they do not yet have the name of the individual in question.

The two prime candidates would appear to be Sébastien Haller (Frankfurt) and Alassane Pléa (Gladbach) - the outlet claims that whichever individual it is, Bayern are already in discussions with them.
With Parma unwilling to let Bruno Alves leave, Juventus have been offered Gary Cahill as the centre-back is set to leave Chelsea, according to Alfredo Pedulla.

Benjamin Pavard explains his decision to join Bayern Munich

France international and World Cup winner Benjamin Pavard discussed his eventual confirmation of a transfer to Bayern Munich, their French connection & why he chose to remain in Germany in an exclusive interview with Bild.

Pavard on when hearing of Bayern Munich’s interest…

Many clubs were interested. But when the offer of Bayern came, I didn’t have to think for a second. Bayern is the best club in the world for me. I want to continue the history of this club, and win many titles there.

Pavard on choosing Bayern Munich & remaining in Germany…

When I stood with Stuttgart in the Allianz Arena tunnel last season, I saw the Bayern players standing next to me and felt the atmosphere. I knew that I want to play there someday. For me, the move was not a question of money. I love Germany, the mentality, the Bundesliga. That’s why I really wanted to stay here.

Pavard on Bayern’s French connection…

These are players at Bayern that I know well from the national team, we get along very well. But the “French Connection” was not the reason for me to go to Munich. There are many players of my age at the club, there is a transition there and I want to be part of it.

Pavard on his best position…

I like to play as a center-back, but if the coach sees me at right back or a six, that’s no problem for me. I will adapt.

Pavard on his time at Stuttgart…

I don’t know how VfB fans will react to my decision. Maybe some will boo me. If so, I accept it. But I would like to say the following: I was always honest with VfB. I hope fans will consider our difficult situation. Only with them together can we get out of there.

https://www.getfootballnewsgermany.com/2019/benjamin-pavard-explains-his-decision-to-join-bayern-munich/

Napoli, Hamsik-Dalian can still happen: the updates

The negotiations were done and his departure announced, then came a complete 180: "Napoli has decided to postpone the transfer of Marek Hamsik." The feeling, however, is that the transfer will still eventually be done.

The Slovakian has decided that he wants to leave, and Chinese club Dalian awaits him. The midfielder was not present at this morning's training with Ancelotti's squad. The player will not leave for his medical visits in Madrid until he is guaranteed that the deal is complete, and is pressing for the deal to be finalized in the meantime.

Yesterday night, Napoli President De Laurentiis revisited the figures of the deal, as he claims that Napoli should receive the 20 million euros from the deal outright and paid in one year. The Chinese club, however, wants to offer 5 million euros for a loan, with an option to buy the player at 15 million euros. Napoli remains unconvinced, but the two sides will likely have to work on a team to satisfy both clubs, as Hamsik's head is already in China.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/napoli-hamsik-dalian-can-still-happen-the-updates
